title: How to get book royalties after getting published - Quora

response.answer_text: Amazon is my avenue for getting my self published books out. I receive a notice stating that you have a royalty payment of ex amount of dollars. That sum is deposited in to my bank account. Monthly, weekly, I do believe that Amazon sends you royalty payments monthly, and I like that because maybe I have amassed quite a bit! But you will receive your Royalty payments, regardless of the avenue that you select to promote your books! Regards, Author Dia Stone

Through book sales and meeting the contract’s minimum to cut you a check. If the publisher printed books and put them in stores and distributors they can take up to 120 or 150 days to pay and they have the right to return unsold books for credit. So you won’t see a check for a while. If you get an advance you won’t see a check until enough books get sold to cover your advance. If you went with a print on demand company, it takes 30 to 120+ days depending on the company and if you get direct deposit, pay pal or check. Amazon requires $100 minimum to cut a check.

Upload your book at different plateform like Amazon, kobo, google playstore. If your book selling start, you get your money at end of months. Amazon give maximum 70% profit for your book Playstore give 52 % . Every publisher haves different term and conditions. You can read their royalty conditions.

It depends on the publisher. Some pay quarterly, others monthly and still others annually. It should say in your publishing contract what the terms are. (If it doesn’t, your contract isn’t that thorough, and that should raise a red flag for you.)
